Pre-Game Insights: A win will bolster England’s chances for a spot in the semis and a loss could bring it down to a net run rate battle.
USA will be playing for pride and hoping to register one last shock when they meet England in their ICC T20 World Cup Super Eight clash.
USA’s stand-in captain Aaron Jones believes his side have made inroads into American fans’ hearts and their performance will help build the game in the baseball-loving nation.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The debutants set the tournament alight with their win over Pakistan and won over fans by qualifying for the Super Eights, but their journey seems to be all but over with two losses in their two Group 2 games so far.
For England, it is a must-win situation as they look to hold on to their T20 World Cup crown.
The Kensington Oval pitch has been one of the few high-scoring surfaces in the Caribbean during this tournament, but has offered ample support to both pace and spin bowlers.

The weather in Bridgetown will remain hot and humid all day, with a chance of a thunderstorm and brief showers shortly before the match.
This will be the first meeting between the two sides in any format of the game.
